oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The tip of the tongue of the Springbok is not eaten by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-25. 6025-6030). When the springbok's tongue-tip is eaten, the person stumbles over a stone and stubs his or her toe.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eating the springbok's tongue-tip
